Item.name: Enable Map View
Item.description: The map view is a great tool used to check your crafts from space, also being able to check other planets and moons in advance.

Item.name: Display Orbit Lines
Item.description: Knowing your rocket trajectory is vital for space travel, this will let you predict where and when you are going to be in a certain spot.

Item.name: Plan Maneuvers
Item.description: Complex space missions require advanced planning tools. Maneuver nodes will let you easily plan your burns to change your orbit according to plan.

Item.name: Max Active Crafts
Item.description: The management of multiple crafts in orbit is complex, this is limited to ensure you don't pollute the system for no reason.

Item.name: Max Contracts Offered
Item.description: Dealing with clients can be overwhelming, but the more contracts you get, the more freedom in your selection you will have.

Item.name: Quick Saving
Item.description: Regrets have never been less of a thing, quicksaving lets you set checkpoints during a mission and go back to them at any point.

Item.name: Undo and Retry
Item.description: Time traveling is a powerful tool, get a second chance after messing it up or hop into the designer to tweak the craft before coming back.

Item.name: Tinker Panel
Item.description: A menu with a handful set of tools that aren't officially supported but that can unlock loads of fun.

Item.name: Custom Launchsites
Item.description: Is there a place you really like? Are you tired of having to get to orbit every time? Just save a launch location and done.

Item.name: Flight Cheats
Item.description: A menu with a handful set of tools that will let you teleport, change gravity, have infinite fuel... your wishes come true!

Item.name: Career Cheats
Item.description: A context menu letting you set contracts as completed and access contract dev QoL tools.

Item.name: Skip Validation
Item.description: Tired of being told you can't launch? No wonder! Do whatever you want with this unlocked.

Item.name: Fuel Lines
Item.description: Fuel lines let you send fuel across any part of your rocket, letting it reach your engines no matter what the configuration of the structure is.

Item.name: Heatshield Coating
Item.description: Heatshield coatings give parts some extra protection to heat, peeling off the extra heat and thus running out over time.

Item.name: Beacon Size
Item.description: The maximum size of the beacons.

Item.name: Crew Capsule Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a crew capsule.

Item.name: Side Detacher Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a side detacher.

Item.name: Docking Port Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a docking port.

Item.name: Electric Motor Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a electric motor.

Item.name: Ion Engine Size
Item.description: The maximum size of an ion engine.

Item.name: Jet Engine Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a jet engine.

Item.name: Joint Rotator Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a joint rotator.

Item.name: Landing Gear Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a landing gear.

Item.name: Landing Gear Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a landing gear.

Item.name: Light Size
Item.description: The maximum size of the lights.

Item.name: Parachute Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a parachute.

Item.name: Piston Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a piston.

Item.name: Propeller Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a propeller assembly.

Item.name: RCS Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a RCS.

Item.name: Rocket Engine Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a rocket engine.

Item.name: Shock Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a shock.

Item.name: Solar Panel Array Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a solar panel Array.

Item.name: Rover Wheel Size
Item.description: The maximum size of a rover wheel.

Item.name: Parachute Radius
Item.display: Manually defined based on (maxSize * radius) m
Item.description: How large your chute can be, increasing its drag.

Item.name: Parachute Chord Length
Item.display: Manually defined based on (5 * maxSize * chordLength) m
Item.description: The length of a parachute chord can make it more stable.

Item.name: Command Disc Battery
Item.description: The amount of volume in a command disc dedicated to store batteries.

Item.name: Command Disc Gyro
Item.description: The amount of volume in a command disc dedicated to store gyroscopes. These can point a craft but can be slow and expensive.

Item.name: Crew Volume
Item.description: The amount of volume available for each crew member in a compartment.

Item.name: Night Vision
Item.description: Night Vision cameras allow you to see in the dark without the need of having lights, but they need at least some light to work.

Item.name: Dead Weight
Item.description: Lead pellets you can put in your fuel tanks to adjust the CoM.

Item.name: Pinch
Item.description: The pinch tool allows you to deform a fuselage to make it narrower on one side.

Item.name: Slant
Item.description: The slant tool lets you make a diagonal cut to the top face of a fuselage.

Item.name: Clamp
Item.description: The clamp tool lets you cut sections out of a fuselage.

Item.name: Curve
Item.description: The curve tool lets you change the profile of a nosecone to any curve.

Item.name: Columns
Item.description: The amount of panels per row the array can have.

Item.name: Rows
Item.description: The amount of rows of panels the array can have.

Item.name: Shape
Item.description: How much the panel can be stretched to tweak its shape.

Item.name: Electric Motor Brakes
Item.description: The brake torque affects how hard it can stop.

Item.name: Electric Motor RPM
Item.description: How fast the electric motor can spin given enough torque.

Item.name: Electric Motor Torque
Item.description: The torque of a motor defines how much force it can do.

Item.name: Propeller Blade Count
Item.description: The number of unique blades in the propeller assembly.

Item.name: Variable Pitch
Item.description: A set of hinges in the propeller blades, allowing for a variable pitch to fine tune their AoA.

Item.name: Wheel Brakes
Item.description: The brake torque affects how hard it can stop a wheel.

Item.name: Wheel Suspension
Item.description: Shock absorbers integrated in the wheels can help drive on bumpy terrain.

Item.name: Wheel Torque
Item.description: The torque of a motor defines how much force it can do.

Item.name: Gear Retraction
Item.description: The hability to retract the landing gear to reduce its drag footprint.

Item.name: Control Surfaces Per Wing
Item.description: The amount of control surfaces you can pack in a single wing.

Item.name: Wing Chord
Item.description: The wing chord is the size the wing can have between its front and back.

Item.name: Wing Span
Item.description: The wing span is its length, the distance between the root and the tip.

Item.name: Wing Thickness
Item.description: How thick a wing can get, making them more resistant to snaps and increasing its fuel storage capacity.

Item.name: Star Grain
Item.description: A solid propellant grain that results in a basic ramp up, hold, ramp down thrust curve.

Item.name: Tubular Grain
Item.description: A solid propellant with a hole in the center, resulting in a ramping up thrust curve.

Item.name: Double Anchor Grain
Item.description: A solid propellant grain that results in a ramping down thrust curve.

Item.name: Rod And Tube Grain
Item.description: A solid propellant grain designed to produce a constant thrust over its entire burn.

Item.name: Multifin Grain
Item.description: A solid propellant grain that burns all of the fuel at the start, resulting in a large impulse followed by a long residual thrust.

Item.name: Bell Nozzle
Item.description: Bell shaped nozzles provide better performance than their conical counterparts. This one is resizable.

Item.name: Cone Nozzle
Item.description: Cone shaped nozzles are about as basic as a nozzle can be, but this one is resizable.

Item.name: Bravo Nozzle
Item.description: It's a basic bell shaped rocket nozzle. More efficient than a cone.

Item.name: Delta Nozzle
Item.description: Resizable bell shaped nozzle with more visual detail.

Item.name: Alpha Nozzle
Item.description: Advanced rocket nozzle with integrated cooling system.

Item.name: Omega Nozzle
Item.description: Gigantic nozzle that pairs well with the Gas Generator II power cycle.

Item.name: Graphite Nozzle
Item.description: A milled piece of graphite, the simplest possible plug to put at the end of a rocket.

Item.name: Echo Nozzle
Item.description: Large nozzle made for solid rocket boosters.

Item.name: Aerospike
Item.description: Aerospike nozzles offer better performance across a wide range of altitudes than bell or cone nozzles.

Item.name: Gas Generator I
Item.description: Gas generator is a powerful type of fuel injection capable of respectable chamber pressures.

Item.name: Gas Generator II
Item.description: It's the muscle car equivalent for rocket engines. It's powerful, but it's not too efficient.

Item.name: Staged
Item.description: Very advanced power cycle capable of extremely high chamber pressures.

Item.name: Full Flow Staged
Item.description: The holy grail of power cycles capable of the highest chamber pressures at the highest efficiency.

Item.name: Pressure Fed
Item.description: The simplest possible rocket engine, it isn't very powerful but it works great in space. As a plus, it can gimbal, enabling for precise maneuvers.

Item.name: Electric
Item.description: A high tech rocket engine without a turbopump, using electric pumps to get the fuel into the chamber.

Item.name: Model Rocket
Item.description: A very small engine with very low efficiencies, perfect for hobbyists or stage separations.

Item.name: Solid Booster
Item.description: An oversized version of the model rocket, perfect to increase the launch thrust of your rockets without spending too much.

Item.name: Nuclear
Item.description: Very efficient, but it doesn't pack a punch.

Item.name: Monopropellant
Item.description: Small, but precise engine.

Item.name: Bypass Ratio
Item.description: This can greatly increase fuel efficiency. All the cool engineers are doing it these days.

Item.name: Compression Ratio
Item.description: Increasing compression can increase fuel efficiency (and thrust up to a point), but also increases the length and weight of the core.

Item.name: Jet Reverse Thrust
Item.description: Reverse thrust lets you invert the force of the engine to help you brake the craft.

Item.name: Jet Afterburner
Item.description: Afterburners can greatly increase thrust by lowering efficiency. And they look cool so win-win.

Item.name: Battery
Item.description: A chemical storage for your power needs, so you don't depend strictly on power generation.

Item.name: Jet Fuel
Item.description: Plane juice, your everyday kerosene, ready to be pumped into a jet engine to spin it up.

Item.name: Kerolox
Item.description: A more refined version of the jet fuel mixed with liquid oxygen, providing high energy density.

Item.name: Hydrolox
Item.description: A very efficient fuel with an incredibly low density, requiring large tanks, mixed with liquid oxygen.

Item.name: Methalox
Item.description: A light and efficient fuel right in between hydrolox and kerolox, mixed with liquid oxygen.

Item.name: Liquid Hydrogen
Item.description: Pure hydrogen without any oxydizer, necessary for combustionless nuclear engines.

Item.name: Water
Item.description: Purified tap water, useful not only as ballast but also for the combustionless nuclear engines.

Item.name: Monopropellant
Item.description: Nasty hypergolic propellant, easy to ignite but insanely toxic.

Item.name: Solid
Item.description: A solid paste easy to store and cheap to produce, that once ignited can't be turned off.

Item.name: Jetpack Fuel
Item.description: A fuel tightly packed on the back of the Drood's suit, allowing for movement in space.

Item.name: Xenon
Item.description: A noble gas with very heavy molecules, that once accelerated to high speeds can result in high efficiencies.

Item.name: None
Item.description: Zero, zilch, zip, nada, nothing.

Item.name: Crew Limit
Item.description: The max amount of Droods that can be hired in the current sandbox.

Item.name: Max Stages
Item.description: The more complex you need to make your crafts, the more stages you will need in order to manage part activations.

Item.name: Doorless Cargo Bay
Item.description: A variant of the cargo bay with no doors, for whatever you may need to have just half a fuselage.

Item.name: Soyuz Interstage
Item.description: Simpler and more rugged, this style of interstage will just ensure things don't come apart until you want.

Item.name: Basic Chair
Item.description: A chair. Usable furniture. Ideal to sit down for a while and... yeah. A chair.

Item.name: Rocket Seat
Item.description: A rocket chair to keep your crew comfy when under the high Gs of a launch.

Item.name: Basic Shroud
Item.description: Jet engines are expensive components, this cover will sure make things look more professional.

Item.name: Chevron Shroud
Item.description: If you want to get fancy, chevron is the way to go, you will be cutting the air like butter.

Item.name: No Shroud
Item.description: A naked engine will afford you some mass, but leave the fragile components exposed to the elements.

Item.name: Straight Fan
Item.description: A bunch of planks spinning fast. It does the job, but it sure is ugly.

Item.name: Curved Fan
Item.description: You may try to lie to yourself thinking you want curved fans to get a better airflow, but we all know you just want their fancy looks.

Item.name: S Curve Fan
Item.description: As you get further away from the rotation axis the ideal angle of attack of the fan blades changes, this fan will match the ideal angle to result in the best looking engines.

Item.name: Military Nozzle
Item.description: Who doesn't want to have a moving nozzle that adjusts its opening to maximize performance and allows for the hottests of exhausts?

Item.name: Civilian Nozzle
Item.description: Civilian nozzles are a fancier version of the basic, ideal for a wide range of sizes, from a small private one to a commercial passenger plane.

Item.name: Basic Nozzle
Item.description: The basic engine nozzle is boring, but effective, and for a cheap craft they will sure do the job.

Item.name: Spiral Tip
Item.description: A fancy bit.

Item.name: Spike Tip
Item.description: A pointy bit.

Item.name: Round Tip
Item.description: A rounded bit.

Item.name: No Tip
Item.description: No bit... how ugly!

Item.name: Single Wheel
Item.description: A single wheel attached on one of its ends.

Item.name: Double Wheel
Item.description: A double wheel, allowing for twice the traction and braking power.

Item.name: Straddled Wheel
Item.description: A single wheel attached on both ends.

Item.name: Straight Door
Item.description: A flat door... yeah, that is all, it is flat and it is a door.

Item.name: Curved Door
Item.description: A curved door that will better match rounded fuselages.

Item.name: No Bay
Item.description: Without a bay the landing gear will be left exposed once retracted.

Item.name: Sideways Door Hinges
Item.description: A hinge that opens a pair of doors towards the sides of the bay.

Item.name: Forwards Door Hinges
Item.description: A hinge that opens a pair of doors alongside the direction of the bay.

Item.name: Single Door Hinge
Item.description: A hinge that opens a door towards one side of the bay.

Item.name: No Door
Item.description: Just a hole, in case you hate aerodynamics.

Item.name: Nosecone Parachute
Item.description: An aerodynamic package meant to be mounted at the front of a craft to split the airstream.

Item.name: Side Parachute
Item.description: A compact package ideal to just snap on the side of your craft to get a handy parachute.

Item.name: Horizontal Stripes
Item.description: A ringed parachute. It makes for a perfect target if you want to train your aim.

Item.name: Vertical Stripes
Item.description: A striped parachute similar to the ones used in crewed capsules.

Item.name: Checkered Pattern
Item.description: A checkered pattern meant to make small parachutes easy to spot in the sky.

Item.name: Rugged Rim
Item.description: A rim containing a motor with tons of torque and a good gear reduction to further increase it.

Item.name: Lunar Rim
Item.description: A rim containing a motor with low torque and a huge gear reduction to get good torque using less power, also keeping speeds down.

Item.name: Retro Rim
Item.description: A rim containing a cheap motor with low torque and a normal gear reduction.

Item.name: Racing Rim
Item.description: A rim containing a motor designed for speed, with decent torque and a great gear increment allowing for very high speeds.

Item.name: Landing Gear Rim
Item.description: A rim containing a motor with normal torque and gear reduction.

Item.name: Rugged Tire
Item.description: A tire with great grip when offroad but mediocre over concrete.

Item.name: Lunar Tire
Item.description: A tire with insanely good offroad grip but very dense and expensive.

Item.name: Smooth Tire
Item.description: The perfect tire for races, with very good grip on concrete but terrible when offroading.

Item.name: Street Tire
Item.description: An average tire with decent grip on concrete and mediocre grip offroad.

Item.name: Landing Gear Tire
Item.description: A well balanced wheel with normal grip on any surface.

Item.name: Drone
Item.description: A set of very agressive blades made out of composite materials, making them very light and powerful.

Item.name: Civilian
Item.description: A classic small aircraft propeller made out of aluminium. All rounded performance for a decent price.

Item.name: Warbird
Item.description: Carved out of wood to imitate the blades in the XX century fighters, perfect for replica lovers.

Item.name: Scimitar
Item.description: A curved blade capable of cutting through the air like a sword. Careful not to put your finger in it.

Item.name: Flat
Item.description: Let it fool you. It looks like a helicopter but it lacks the swashplate. Players will surely find a way to make helis out of this.

Item.name: Vortex
Item.description: A small boat propeller, perfect for motorboats of small submarines.

Item.name: Riptide
Item.description: A very large boat propeller made out of heavy steel. Watch out for the icebergs.

Item.name: Striped Fuselage
Item.description: Striped variants of all the fuselages, including fuel tanks, interstages, fairings... To add a pop of color to your crafts.

Item.name: Rounded Noses
Item.description: Although their colliders are still pointy, rounded noses are perfect for anything spherical.

Item.name: Thin Film
Item.description: Low efficiency but cheap panels, good enough to power your most basic needs.

Item.name: Monocrystalline
Item.description: An old but reliable technology, more expensive than thin film but at the same time, more efficient.

Item.name: Perovskite
Item.description: Top tier solar panels, breaking the theoretical limits of maximum efficiency using fancy new materials.

Item.name: Thin Film
Item.description: Low efficiency but cheap panels, good enough to power your most basic needs.

Item.name: Monocrystalline
Item.description: An old but reliable technology, more expensive than thin film but at the same time, more efficient.

Item.name: Perovskite
Item.description: Top tier solar panels, breaking the theoretical limits of maximum efficiency using fancy new materials.

Item.name: New Contracts
Item.description: You will get new contracts after unlocking this tech.

Item.name: New Contracts
Item.description: You will get new contracts after unlocking this tech if you already have 'Check Your Staging'.

Item.name: New Contracts
Item.description: You will get new contracts after unlocking this tech, but they may require other dependencies like certain contracts being completed.

Node.name: What Are You Even Trying To Do
